11112.content:
Life was, to sum it up in one word...boring. Day in and day out the same routine, get up, go to work, head home, nothing ever changed. You sat back in your desk and sighed as the realization hit you, there was no more drive, no spirit, it was just toil to stay alive and that was it. You heard the familiar buzzer your company's clock gave off when it was quitting time. Sighing again you stand up and start heading for the elevator so you can head home.

"Hey" you freeze as you hear your boss' voice, turning around he walks up a small smile on his lips. "How's everything going?" he asks.

"Fine....no problems" you reply really unsure of why he was talking to you.

"I need a favour" he says, the smile on his facing growing. You prepare for the inevitable phrase "you have to work unpaid overtime, I need you to come in early" that sort of thing and even prepare to sigh. Your boss however holds out a pair of basketball tickets "here, my wife got me these so I could take someone to a game since, for some reason she thought I was into basketball. I couldn't just refuse her, so I'm giving them to you" he says.

"Uh....thanks" you reply taking the tickets and just staring at them for a few seconds. "Hey wait who am I supposed to..." by the time you were done the sentence your boss had rune off and you were left there. You get into the elevator and examine the ticket, it was at the local stadium tonight, however who were the "Toonville Tornadoes," you shrug thinking it must be some sort of advertising gimmick and walk out of the elevator as it reaches ground level. You head home, a simple apartment, one bedroom, small living room like area and a kitchen. It wasn't much and it certainly wasn't a palace but it was home. Getting changed out of your work clothes, and into something more casual, just a shirt and a pair of pants you head out for the basketball game, although basketball isn't exactly your favourite sport you figure that you might as well enjoy yourself. Running out of your apartment and to the bus stop you're just able to make the bus heading to the stadium.

When you get to the stadium you rush in as you hear a buzzer, quickly giving the guard your ticket you race past him just finding your seat in the stadium as the lights go off. You look around for a second confused until two spotlights focus on one side of the court and you realize they were introducing the teams. You didn't pay that much attention as your home team was introduced, all you knew about them was they were just your average basketball team and that was it. Your head however perked up as the other team was introduced as you didn't know anything about them, thankfully your boss got average seats so you weren't just looking down on them from the rafters. Everything seemed normal until the last member of the team walked out onto the court, and you couldn't help but stare as you saw her.

It wasn't the fact that it was a girl that made you stare, it was a combination of factors. To start off she looked like she was half the size of everyone else, maybe 3'4" if that. Second was her appearance, as she was covered in what looked to be tan fur from the top of her ears to the soles of her feet. Her ears had to be about a foot long, much longer than her blonde hair, they were held out of the way behind her, tied together by a purple band of some kind. Her face even looked different, a small pinkish nose in the center instead of a normal one. The ref blew his whistle and both sides had their players stand for the jump and suprisingly the rabbit or bunny or whatever she was girl stood facing a guy twice her size. The whistle was blown and she leapt up grabbing the ball out of the air and landing on her feet before jumping up just as high again, letting the ball go. Your eyes as well as everyone else's followed that ball as it flew through the air and with a swish, landed in the basket. The entire stadium, you included erupted into cheers as every player on the court and the ref stood dazed for a second before the game resumed.

The rest of the game went along in much the same fashion, amazing basket after amazing basket was scored one after the other. It was a complete blowout, you weren't a huge hometown fan but even the people who showed up in the town's colors were smiling as they got out of their seats and walked out of the building. You were completely blown away, in fact for once in the last couple of months you felt that something interesting was happening. At the very least you felt that you had to go talk to this girl and congratulate her. It wasn't that hard to separate from the rest of the crowd and head to the back entrances of the building, since there were only two exits. You near the doors for a while rubbing your hands to keep them warm in the nippy winter air. One by one or in groups the players started to come out, although that was after thirty minutes. Finally she stuck her head out the door, literally she stuck her head out and looked around, although she somehow missed you before walking out.

"Um...excuse me" you say, her body freezing as she hears your voice, she turns around as you walk forward and this time she definitely notices you.

"Oh, hello" she says a small frown on her face turning into a smile as she realizes you're not a reporter, even though she has to look up at you.

"That was one hell of a game you played, I've never seen basketball like that" you say.

"Oh...thanks, most people who talk about my game, normally don't compliment me" she says.

"Is it because you're a girl?" you ask

"Partially, well that and, how I look" she replies.

You bend over so it's easier to talk with her "the whole bunny thing?" you ask.

"Yeah" she replies. "So is there any other reason you followed me back here?" she asks.

"Hmmm...not really, just to congratulate you on a game well played" you say. She nods and seems to think for a moment, "have you ever taken on a professional before?" she asks.

"Um....no" you reply.

Her smile grows bigger "would you like to? The stadium's still open, so we could have a one-on-one" she says.

"You took on guys that were all bigger and better than me, how am I supposed to take you on?" you reply.

"Scared of a little girl bunny?" she asks.

"On the basketball court, yes I am" you reply.

That smile breaks into a huge grin "well you're at least honest" she says.

"Since you're that free, you want to go have something to eat? I'll pay" you ask.

"Sure, but you should at least tell me your name" she says.

"Alex, nice to meet you...." you trailed off unable to remember her name when it was announced.

"Lola, Lola bunny" she replies. You stand back up and start walking, you assume she starts following you as she quickly sidles up next to you.

"So, do you go to dinner with every fan who offers?" you ask.

"Only the ones who offer, which you're the first" she replies.

You nod slowly, "so why aren't you going to celebrate with your teammates?" you ask.

She shrugs "they think I'm a show-off, most didn't even want to let me on the team in the first place" she replies. You nod, the rest of the walk becoming quite silent.
11112.title: Lola bunny

111231.content:
Michael’s eyes roamed the computer screen, profiles ont the website in front of him flying past him although each was scanned in turn. The profiles ranged from the simplistic with usernames like Kelly12 and a picture of the woman’s face to the downright lascivious. What a woman with the username MILFMistress; her picture looking as would be expected, was doing on a normal dating website was beyond him. Page after page flew past him as lead after lead turned up empty, most of the women who interested him either hadn’t signed into the website for several months or were so obviously manufactured it was insulting. Sighing in defeat he collapsed back into his chair, with a swivel of the mouse his cursor was on the red X to shut down the page when “ping.”

“MouseGirl would like to chat” the textbox appeared in the centre of his screen, the usual flashing red NO ad green YES buttons sitting beneath the text. He took a moment to examine the woman’s profile picture and he had to admit it confused him. Every profile he’d seen on the site so far had either the person’s face, or if they were trying to attract attention a close-up of the body, but MouseGirl didn’t. Her picture was of a large blue bow on top of something black with the edges of what he had to assume were two large black circles just fitting into the picture. He took a few moments to think about it before deciding to throw caution to the wind and clicked yes.

There was another ping and a small chat window appeared in the bottom left corner of his screen. It didn’t take long before “ping,” MouseGirl sent her first message and the chat began.

“Hi there  I’m pretty new to the site, and you seemed like a nice guy so I thought you’d like to chat.” Michael was a bit taken aback for a second by the brutal honesty…or naivety of whoever he was taking to, but he wasn’t about to fail their expectations of him.

“I’m glad you think so highly of me, although I’m pretty new to this site myself” he replied, his mouse flicked up to open a new tab “more info couldn’t hurt” he muttered as he looked up the girl’s name and subsequently her profile. Several clicks and keystrokes later he had her profile up and it was…blank, rather where there should have been information were instead miniature lock icons. “What doesn’t she want people to see” he muttered, the site had a privacy feature, but this was the first time he’d ever seen it used. “I wonder if….“ping”’ the sound drew his attention back to the chat window.

“What are you doing on the site?” the question caught him off guard as he knew why he was on the site but it was a bit embarrassing. ‘Better to be honest from the start’ Michael thought as he began to type.

“Originally, I didn’t really have any interest in the site; my parents actually went behind my back and made this account because they thought I had been “lonely” long enough. Since they went to all the trouble I decided to give it a chance. Why are you on this site?” He was left waiting for almost an entire minute for her reply but when it arrived it was a full story.

“…it started out with our dates, simple things like the fact he’d pack a nice lunch and we’d have a picnic ad that was it, but that was the only date we’d ever had and there’s only so many times you can eat tomato sandwiches and sit on the same hill before it gets boring. When he finally did start taking us out for other dates he’d always bring his friends along with us. He never seemed to understand my hints that we should be alone! After that he started to be late for our dates and after that began to forget them entirely, I couldn’t stand it anymore so I broke up with him!!....”sigh”’

Michael had to pause for several seconds as he read the entire story, he hadn’t exactly expected something this serious and wasn’t entirely sure how to react to it.

“I’m sorry to hear that, I can’t say I really understand what you’re going through as I’ve never really been in a relationship before. But since you seemed to do everything you could to keep the relationship together it’s really his fault, and if he’s foolish enough to let someone like you go then that’s his loss. I’m sure once you find that guy who truly appreciates you then you’ll be happy together.” He had to admit that the reply was cheesy, and he probably overstepped his bounds given that they hadn’t even known each other an hour, but she seemed nice enough and….“ping” there was her reply.

“MouseGirl would like to make you a “private” friend, do you accept?” Michael only took a moment to pause before accepting, the acceptance he knew would open up her entire profile to him, and his to her. Looking back to her profile he was surprised by a few things he saw, but the most intriguing thing was her real name. “Minnie Mouse” he muttered to himself, it was certainly a unique name as Mouse wasn’t a last name he’d ever heard before. Besides her name the only other noteworthy piece of information was the fact that they lived in the same city.

“Ping” “I didn’t realize you were a younger man….is 30 years old too old for you?” He had to take a while to think about it.

“Is 23 too young for you?” Michael replied as he honestly didn’t mind the age difference, but it was a two-way street.

“…No, I don’t mind” was Minnie’s quick reply.

“I don’t either, why do you ask?” He had an idea, but considering how little they really knew of each other he wasn’t exactly entertaining that thought.

“No reason…what would you ideal date be?” Minnie’s question wasn’t exactly out of left field given what she had told him about her past.

“Well…if I had the chance to meet the right woman I’d start off by taking her out to a movie, her choice. After that I’d take her out to a nice restaurant and show her a good time. Finally I guess we’d just go take a stroll through the local park under the moonlight.” He had to admit that it was as stereotypical a date plan as was possible, but it was the only real plan he knew of.

“….Are you free on Saturday?” Michael physically pushed his chair back as he read the question; the meaning behind those words was plain even to someone as dense as him.

“….are you implying what I think you’re implying” he replied hesitantly.

“Well I did say that I was looking for someone new, and you seem quite kind. You listened to me tell my sob story and you haven’t tried to push me or been rude in anyway.”

Michael pushed back from his computer as he thought the proposal over, on the one hand they’d barely even met each other, he had no idea what he actually knew of her and didn’t even know what she looked like. On the other hand the only real thing he’d lose would be time, well that and like…$120-$150, ok the money loss bothered him but nothing was ever gained without first taking action.

“How does 5:30 sound to you? Although you wouldn’t happen to have a car would you?” he replied. He hated asking that question but he still didn’t have a vehicle.

“The time sounds fine, and I have a car. I know your address from your profile so I’ll pick you up, see you Saturday ” With that reply Minnie signed off and Michael was left sitting there for several moments. “I guess I have a date” he muttered to himself as he fell back into his chair.

111232.title: Daisy Duck

1112321.content:
Robert couldn’t help but sigh in relief as the cool autumn breeze wafted over him. It was one of the few positives of walking to work; however it was also a harbinger of the snow to come. The dreaded white flakes turned his normal five minute stroll into a half an hour trudge as no one ever thought about those who had to walk in winter.

“Bzzzzttt” the sound of the streetlight turning on startled him almost as much as the flash of light right in his face; there was no way it was that late was there? He had been asked to stay back to get some extra paperwork done, but it had proceeded smoothly and he was uninterrupted as he worked. With a shake of his head and an exasperated sigh he continued on, nothing he could do about it now. Slowly his pace increased to a slow jog as all he wanted to do now was get home and relax until “WAGHHHHGHHH” the scream came from his left, cutting through the stillness of the night he watched as silhouettes appeared in the windows of the homes neighbouring the one the scream originated from.

Several moments later the door to the home burst open and a woman came running out sobbing hysterically, she barrelled past him the two of them almost colliding. As she rushed past he saw something strange, it looked like she had a…beak? Looking back to the house he saw a male figure back-lit in the doorway before “slam” it the door was closed abruptly. Turning to face the direction the woman had run off in he felt a gnawing in the pit of his stomach.

‘you should go help her’ his consciousness spoke.

‘I’ve got nothing to do with this’ Robert chided himself however just saying that felt…wrong. “I’m probably going to regret this” he mumbled conceding to his conscious. He took off after the woman the sound of her sobs the only thing he needed to follow. He found her sitting on one of the park benches quietly sobbing. As he now had the time to examine her he was able to see she was a woman of above-average height with a slightly hourglass figure. Her outfit was composed of a simple light blue t-shirt and a midnight blue vest and a skirt. The light blue vest hugged her modest chest while the skirt accented her wider hips. However there were a few things that bothered him as he stared at the woman. She seemed to be covered head to...webbed foot in bright white plumage. Well she wasn’t completely covered in white plumage; her long slender legs were covered in the same orange material that made up her feet. Further adding to her very “duck-ish” appearance was the fact she had a beak extending about 2 inches from her face. The only normal thing about her was the ponytail that fell down to her shoulder composed of her white hair, the colour of her hair being the obvious abnormality of that attribute.

“Ahem” her head snapped up at the sound and to his surprise she hurriedly made to wipe away the tears. “Miss are you alright?” he asked taking a seat next to her on the bench. After several seconds and no reply he decided to press forward “I heard a loud yell and next thing I know you’re barreling past me in tears, who exactly was it that was yelling?”

“Donald, he’s my boyfriend” she replied hesitantly, her voice low as her eyes darted around the park like she expected him to pop out of nowhere.

“You seem a bit…nervous, is there a problem?” Robert didn’t exactly want to get involved but considering her actions he couldn’t just leave her as she was.

“NO, no Donald might yell and stomp around but he’d never go any further than that” she replied although whether it was to convince him or herself he wasn’t entirely sure.

“If you say so” he replied leaning back on the bench “so I know we’ve just met, but I’m Robert” he said sitting up and smiling at her.

“Daisy duck” she replied demurely. His eyebrow rose at her last name, but it kind of explained her…unique physical features. here were several moments of silence as the two of them sat there. Neither seemed willing to make the first move until the sound of a garbage lid falling to their left startled both of them. Robert looked down as he felt a weight settle on his side, Daisy pressing against him, her fingers digging into his shirt. She looked up and with a gasp quickly pulled back “I-I’m sorry, I didn’t mean.”

“It’s alright” he replied smiling gently at her “I know this isn’t really my place, but you seem really jumpy. Are you sure nothing’s happened?” he asked.

“NO” she yelled in reply bursting from the bench “nothing happened and it never will; I already said that. Donald, Donald would never hurt me…he wouldn’t” her voice became quieter as she spoke however she couldn’t meet his gaze.

There was nothing Robert could do after a reply like that. Feeling around in his pocket he pulled out a card and after a several seconds of searching in his coat he pulled out a pen “here’s my number and address, I know it’s not exactly much, but if something ever happens…” he trailed off as he held out the card.

Robert was quite surprised as despite her insistence that there wasn’t and never would be any problems she took the card from his hand and placed it inside a shirt pocket. “Thank you, not many people would stop and pay attention to a girl crying by herself let alone help someone they didn’t know like this.” He was surprised as her beak which itself being surprisingly soft pressed against his cheek for a moment. He just had time to reach up and touch his cheek and she was already gone, running off into the night.

“….I guess that’s that” Robert muttered to himself, hopefully she’d never need to use the card that he gave her. Whether he was thinking that simply because that meant her relationship was well or because he honestly wasn’t sure how he’d handle another meeting with Daisy he couldn’t say.

Shaking his head he jogged back home, the one-bedroom bungalow was to him quite spacious, the front door led to the entranceway with the kitchen straight ahead and the living room to his left. Sighing he pulled his shoes off and turning down the hallway to the right walked past the bathroom to his bedroom. He collapsed onto the bed and simply lay there for several moments as he let the events of the day wash over him as he finally had time to take everything in. He flipped over and stared at the ceiling for several moments before letting out an exasperated sigh. “I got involved in some sort of domestic problem I had nothing to do with, and I even gave the woman my home address. That is s going to come back and bite me in the ass later I just know it” he muttered to himself.

Sighing he got up and headed for the kitchen “nothing I can do about it now, I’ll just deal with that when and if it comes to anything.” Slowly Robert got back up and headed for the kitchen, after preparing a few simple sandwiches he quickly devoured them. Not having anything better to do he plopped himself down on the couch in the middle of his living room and watched a few hours of television. Glancing at the clock on the wall he realized that it was fairly late. It didn’t take long to walk back into his bedroom and get changed into his pajamas as well as crawl into bed. After several seconds of adjusting his position on the bed Robert yawned tiredly and reaching over to the lamp extinguished the light.

11123221.content:
Jacob was just enjoying his dinner, the restaurant which he was currently attending was what he’d like to call a “middle-class” affair as while certainly not a 5 star restaurant there was an atmosphere to the building, one of calm and relaxation as the patrons simply enjoyed their meal. The calm however was broken by a comical yell, Jacob’s head snapping up from his meal as it reverberated through his ears.

Looking towards the source of the sound he noticed something unusual about the patrons sitting at the table, a male and female pair, the man dressed in a suit-jacket and a black shirt, with matching dress pants, the woman was dressed in a long sky-blue dress with a slit on the side revealing long legs purple heels around her long swan-like neck was what looked like a cowbell necklace, both patrons wore white gloves but that didn’t seem too out of place. The only words he could use were the woman was a cow, and the man was a dog. Normally this would be meant as an insult but in this case it was meant literally as the woman had the horns and face of a cow while the man had the ears and face of a dog. These weren’t the only differences from a normal person however as both had what he could only describe as “ink black” bodies, except for the cow woman’s muzzle and the dog man’s snout which were both cream coloured.

The dog man seemed to be apologizing about a spilled bowl of soup, the cause of the yell from earlier. The waiter while glaring daggers at him from what Jacob could hear was assuring the man in response that it was an accident and that it would be no trouble to take care of it. The dog man didn’t seem to accept that answer however and went to pick up the bowl the soup had been spilled from.

What happened next was something that could only be described as “cartoonish”, as reaching for the bowl the dog man slipped in a puddle of soup, another comical yell leaving his throat as he slipped and toppled backwards. Yet as he slipped there was a much louder sound, a loud “rip” and then silence as all eyes of the restaurant had fallen upon the cow woman, her dress lay in the dog man’s hand, she being left in nothing but a matching purple bra and panty set as well as her heels.

While he hadn’t been able to completely hear the earlier exchange Jacob, the entire restaurant, and probably those on the street heard what was said next. Vitriolic wasn’t a good enough word to be used for the furious tirade that left the cow woman’s mouth, several people that had been nearby and had stood up to help physically retreated as she went off into her furious tirade. Finally she was escorted to the back, presumably for the restaurant to figure something out about getting her home without having to walk mostly naked down the street and like that it was over.

“Waiter, check please” Jacob called, as while the incident had certainly been interesting, it had killed his appetite, surprisingly it was the waiter who had been helping the couple that came up to his table, the man’s cheeks flushed crimson as he silently handed the check to Jacob. In a few seconds the debt was settled and Jacob headed for the exit, just catching a glimpse of the cow woman leaving through a back door.

Walking back home he passed his neighbours place, the large 2 story home didn’t look much different than any other on the street, except for the large bay windows which provided a glimpse into living-room of the home and the hedge walls separating it from the homes on either side of it. Looking up he saw a light on in what Jacob had to assume was the master bedroom, the owner of the home had always been a mystery to him, whether due to scheduling or sheer coincidence the two had never met despite being neighbours for years.

Shrugging Jacob turned and walked back to his own home. Walking in the front door he followed his nightly routine, showered, brushed his teeth, and got ready for bed, a quick look at the alarm clock indicated that his alarm was indeed off as the next day was Saturday, one of his two days off. The light of morning came all too quickly in Jacob’s eyes, the thin shafts of light penetrated through his bedroom window and his eyes, groaning and sitting up he took a glance at the clock which read “11:30.” He was caught off guard at how late it was, as he had gone to bed fairly early the night before, but it was a day of rest so he wasn’t overly concerned. Getting dressed in a pair of black shorts and an orange t-shirt his hazel eyes scanned his bedroom and finding nothing out of place he let out a small sigh of relief and headed downstairs. ‘Let’s see am I running low on anything’ he though as he headed into the kitchen to prepare breakfast, a simple bowl of cereal. Checking the cupboards and fridge his rations weren’t low but he could do with a bit more fruit. Resolving to get some, his black coat soon slid over his arms and he was out the door, taking but a moment to lock it behind him.

With a spring to his step he headed out, walking right past his neighbours house he froze in his tracks, as there was something wrong. Spinning on his heel he saw something he had never expected to see, on her hands and knees in the dirt, a trowel in one hand and a basket of bulbs sitting behind her was the cow woman from yesterday. She was dressed in a gardener’s garb, a large straw hat adorned her head, jeans and a t-shirt covered her body while a pair of thicker gardening gloves and brown boots covered her hands and feet respectively.

He honestly wasn’t sure if he should say hello as he was sure she hadn’t seen him, but considering what he had seen last night he wasn’t sure if he could maintain the conversation without it becoming awkward. Steeling himself he stepped forward, the cow woman’s head snapping up as soon as his foot hit the grass causing him to freeze again.

“Oh, you’re the man who lives next door” her voice when not ripping someone a new one was quite pleasant, quite beautiful.

“Yeah, I think we’ve honestly missed each other for years, unless someone else has been living in this house the past few years” Jacob replied, leaning forward he saw that besides the woman’s larger than average eyes they were…black, either that or her iris was such a dark colour as to look black.

“It’s a pleasure to finally make your acquaintance then, I’m Clarabelle” she said standing up and offering a gloved hand.

“Jacob and the pleasure is all mine” he replied, missing the slight blush that crossed Clarabelle’s face as he took her hand. “So, planting some flowers? I’m sure they’ll look a lot better than that hedge?”

Clarabelle’s face twisted at the mention of the hedge “yes, I’ve been meaning to replace that for years, but it’s so expensive, so I thought adding some flowers would brighten the yard up a bit, make it less…closed in” she continued.

“Do you need a hand?” the words were out of Jacob’s mouth before he really realized what he was saying.

“Oh that would be just wonderful, I’d love some help” Clarabelle replied, a small smile spreading across her face. “I already have the places I want to plant the flowers marked, if you could just dig a hole big enough for the bulb that would really help me out” Clarabelle said offering up her trowel.

“Sure” Jacob took the instrument and began to dig, the dirt thankfully was easy enough to move, and he quickly had first hole dug, reaching back for a bulb his hand met Clarabelle’s and he pulled back “sorry.”

“Oh, no it was my fault” she replied as the bulb was passed over. From there they developed a rhythm, with Jacob digging the holes and Clarabelle planting the bulbs behind him. The two of them working quite quickly, and in an hour and a half they had every bulb planted around the yard, Jacob falling back as he wiped some sweat from his brow.

(m/m) Name: Kai Tanaka
Species: Akita
Kai is a skinny, shy dog that always thought humans were rather mean... but you had always been a good friend, no matter what. Now that the two of you are in college, you decided to move in together as roommates, rather than subject him to the rough furs and humans in the college dormitories. Life has been good with him. He's responsible, and takes care of a lot of the chores around the apartment. But you've noticed he's been acting strange lately: blushing when you ask him something, being extra nice, and yet he avoids you away from home, his face glowing red whenever he does see you outside. Does he...have feelings for you?

Species: Arctic Fox
Akiko was always the beautiful, smart girl out of your reach. She always kind of liked you, but was afraid to say so since other men were always offering themselves to her and breaking up later. But now, you have nowhere to go. You were fired from the one job you had, and tried to scrape together the money to pay rent. But by the time the payment was due, you moved yourself out, rather than wait for you to get in trouble with the law. You spent two awful and grudgingly slow days on the street, trying to find someone who'd hire you. But while you sat on the park bench, Akiko saw you, and decided to make conversation since it'd been forever. She was heartbroken by your troubles, and decided to let you stay with her until you could get back on your feet. Only now, she might want you to stay...

choices: He finally confesses his true feelings for you
He gets too nervous and doesn't reveal the truth
1321.content:
You and Kai had been friends your entire lives. And it all started in elementary school, when Kai was sitting on the floor, crying because a group of human boys had insulted him non stop all recess. The other furs on the playground didn't stop the boys, and just let him get hurt by their words. You walked up to him slowly, and he looked up at you with suspicion through his watery eyes.

"What do you want, Nao?" He said, rubbing his eyes. "Don't talk to me, you're just another human like those meanies..." Kai said, turning away. You kneeled down, touching his shoulder. "No, I'm not like them. Don't listen to them, they don't know how awesome you are! And you know what, I'll show you I'm not like them. I'll be your friend forever and ever!"

And so you and Kai had grown up together. You went through the awkwardness of middle school, the stress of high school, your first jobs, your first car (and first wreck), and now you even lived together, all with him by your side. He was an incredible friend, but you had never expected him to feel this way about you.
-------
The two of you were planning to go to this concert for months, and now you were finally going! You drive down the freeway, with him in the passenger seat, to the other side of town where the event is being held. He looks down, as though he's deep in thought. The orange dog was a lot like you in size, as both of you were average height and really skinny. Since it was a concert you both knew was going to involve lots of sweating, he wore a white tank top and shorts, his curled tail pressed against the seat.

It made you wonder: what was he thinking about? Lately he'd been like this, not talking quite as much. Whenever he did talk, he was either really nervous or overly nice. You focus on the road, deciding you might ask him after the night is over.

-------

You stand with Kai in the darkness, and all around you are the excited murmurs of everyone else. The lights raise up, and the music begins to play. The crowd, including you and your friend cheer as the spotlight shows the dj. The lights start to flash in different colors, and you look at Kai under the lights, smiling with joy as the buildup begins. You both throw your hands up to the sky...

-------

You're both drenched in sweat. It was a good thing you both decided to wear the minimal clothes. You decide to fill the empty silence as you both walk to the car in the huge parking lot. "That was awesome! Just as epic as I thought it'd be." You say, smiling at him. "Especially that one song that was all: 'Bom bom bom boom bom bom'".

He can't help but smile at your attempt to sing the song. "Heh, yeah...it was awesome." You see his tail perk up for a moment, but then it droops right back down again. He seems to be thinking.

The silence lasts until the two of you get to the car. The doors close with the usual thunk. You both click the seat belts in. You're about to start the car, but then he stops you.

"Nao...tonight was absolutely amazing...and...I think you're..."

1341.content:
The old woman turned and smiled.

“I think I have exactly what you want; it just came in so it’s in the back somewhere,” she said in a thin and wheezy voice.

As she turned again to pass through the curtain dividing the store, Sarah couldn’t help but roll her eyes. How many other times had she come to similar dark and dreary stores just like this one in the hopes of finding something legitimately magical? Sure, she had occasionally found something with a tiny spark of magic within, but those were few and far between. Far more common was the random bits and bobs that likely never had any connection to anything magical at all. With a muted sigh, she reminded herself that few people believed in magic anymore, and most of that small fraction were fringe weirdoes at best.

Minutes whirled past as she found herself looking over the odds and ends filling the dusty shelves. It was taking long enough that she was starting to consider leaving without a word. Just as she had almost made up her mind, the stooped old raven returned, clutching an ill-maintained box in both hands.

“Here we are,” she rasped with a twinkle in her eyes. “A rather unpleasant young man came in ranting about quite a number of things. Oh, you should have heard the peculiar things he kept talking about as if they were real.” A cackle quickly turned into a coughing fit that took quite a while before she could continue. “Now where was I? Ah, yes, I think it might be exactly what you are looking for.”

Setting the box down on the counter, her stiff fingers struggled with the latch. Sarah wasn’t very hopeful, but she couldn’t stop the tingle of anticipation from spreading through her body either. After several nerve-wracking seconds, the latch finally came undone, and the lid of the box was eased back revealing…
1341.title: Another chance

choices: It works perfectly, the magic within the amulet flowing into her.
Sarah must have missed something because she starts changing uncontrollably.
A frown crosses her fact as nothing happens.
13411.content:
Within the box lay a small amulet. Its circular shape was dotted with a variety of gemstones and twisting between them was swirls and characters from an extremely old and rare language. The most telling part was that the tingle of anticipation the busty bovine had been feeling bloomed into an electric jolt that raced throughout her body. That feeling was well known to her, but she had never experienced quite so strongly. She reached out with trembling fingers, her eyes locked on the worn gold. Just as she was about to touch, the box was shut with a snap. Sarah yelped as her fingers were almost caught. Scowling, she looked up at the store’s owner.

There was a twinkle in the old raven’s eyes as she said, “Ah, ah, no touching. Not without talking price that is.”

Price wasn’t much of a concern to Sarah, but the outrageously inflated price the raven led with made Sarah balk. The allure of the power contained within the trinket was overwhelming though, so she began a lengthy process to haggle the price down to a more reasonable point.

Exiting the store with her hard won amulet in hand, Sarah could feel the steady thrum of power flowing out of it. She wasn’t even wearing it yet, so she could understand the story told by the Raven. Something this powerful could have an effect on the world around it even without someone channeling it. She could hardly resist the urge to put it on, but knew that there was risk to diving in without doing some tests first. So she hurried back to her car and drove away, heading for home.

Leaving the elevator, she darted across the hall and through the door. She then walked straight up to what appeared to be an ordinary wall within her home. A flutter of her fingers and a little trickle of power caused the hidden door to ease open, letting her into her inner sanctum.

Several hours later, she stood over the table, bleary eyed but overflowing with anticipation. She had run through every test she could and found no trace of a curse or anything else harmful. Reaching out, she plucked the amulet from the armature where she had conducted the latest tests. She then slipped the golden chain over her head and pulled her hair free, letting the chain settle against her neck. Releasing the amulet, she felt the warm metal slip down between her breasts to be almost hidden in the canyon between.
13411.title: A taste of what’s to come

choices: It’s Jade, the obese headliner dragoness of the club.
It’s Vanessa, a curvy dragoness that frequents this club as well.
134111.content:
A moment after the amulet came to rest it was as if there was a lightning bolt striking her. Every muscle in Sarah’s body tensed and she was blinded for what felt like an eternity. Blinking her eyes and shaking her head, she instead found that not even a second had passed. In that moment though, she knew how much had changed, how much more power she could draw on now. A wave of her hand and a few quiet words and everything in her lab was cleaned up and back in its place. A smile crossed her face as she thought about what was within her reach now.

A chirp from her phone brought her back to the present. It was a text from her lover asking if they were still meeting up at the club tonight. After confirming that they were, Sarah retreated from her lab and sealed the door behind her. A quick snack and shower later, she swapped her casual clothes for a nice and tight club dress and was back down the elevator to her car. Pulling out onto the street, she weaved her way through the traffic across town.

Sarah skipped past the line waiting outside, drawing plenty of annoyed glances and aggravated comments. She didn’t spare a moment’s thought for that though. The bouncer looked irritated for a moment – squaring his shoulders and opening his mouth to go through the whole “back of the line” warning. Then his eyebrows shot up into his hairline as he saw just who she was. The big rhino turned much more sheepish as he apologized to Sarah and let her through.

Slipping in the door, Sarah stepped the side to let her eyes adjust to the dim light. The music thumped in her ears as she saw the center stage and the current performer: a curvy snake currently winding her way up the pole. Her tail flexed and pulsed in time, promising plenty of exquisite pleasure from the pressure. The snake was also making sure that plenty of attention was on her breasts, heaving with every motion as they were barely contained in the thin and wispy top.

Turning her attention away from the stage, Sarah sashayed across the room, attracting plenty of attention herself along the way. The bouncer at the VIP section was much more cordial to Sarah, greeting her and admitting her with a smile. She thanked the lion before taking a seat at one of the empty tables.

After ordering a White Russian, Sarah spared a glance around the room. She spotted a few others she recognized and they raised a glass or tipped their head if they saw her as well.

“There you are, I wasn’t sure if you were going to make it on time,” a very familiar voice said from behind Sarah, bringing a smile to the bovine’s full lips.

1431.content:
Jade strolled along Nexus park lazily, enjoying the sights. She'd just moved into nexus city and some of the locals told her to go around and check out nexus park. They said it was lovely, until nightfall that was. Jade giggled, figuring they were scared of the dark or something. The sun was setting and Jade was not planning on leaving for another hour or two. The way the air felt on a late summer night was amazing... Not quite hot, but not cold either... It was always so soothing. A few minutes passed and Jade checked her watch, 8:46. Meh, she could be out here another hour or two. She had nothing going on so it was no skin off her back! Jade continued on for a bit, until she heard a bit of rustling in the foliage. "Mur?" She questioned, stopping and putting a finger to her lip. "Oooor maybe going home right now isn't such a bad idea..." Jade quickly began to turn around, only to run into a hulking figure towering above her. It seemed to be a large wolf, but it was bipedal and much taller than even the average human, standing maybe around... Seven and a half feet tall? It's maw dripped saliva onto the ground before her. Jade was filled with terror, unable to move, unable to speak. What was this ungodly creature?

The beast snarled, dripping more saliva. Then it howled, loud and high. The the beast reeled unto her, falling towards Jade, ready to snatch her up and do god knows what with.

"Eh-Ah-AHHHHHHHH!" Jade cried out, closing her eyes and turning away. The beast howl continued but was cut off shortly after. The beast whined and growled low.

"Stay down, keep right there." A low voice spoke, blunt and hard, as if the man was struggling with something.

Jade merely continued to cry in response, curled up on the ground. She heard a few blunt *WHACK*s followed by a dull thud and low growling. Soon it faded away, replaced by deep breathing.

"Are you alright Miss?"

The man from before asks, placing a hand on her shoulder. Jade shivers visibly and quite badly. She was obviously very shaken up. She opened her eyes through tears that fogged her vision and looked up. The figure looking down upon her was blurred and fuzzy but she could just make out the man, green top, black pants and... A black face? Jade rubbed her eyes some more and looked back to the man. The man had dark grey fur all over his body, only covered by a green hoodie and black pants. Seven grey, white tipped tails swung behind him. Looking further up to his face Jade found it resembled that of a... A fox? Dark green eyes in the skull of a fox mixed with that of a mans. Black hair covered one eye. The natural not warm not cool air grew cold and Jade began to shake more. Her eyes twitched and her mouth opened as if she were about to scream. Then it all stopped and she fell over, losing a grip on what was going on.
